text:
“I am well and perfectly fine,” NCP leader Sharad Pawar tweeted on Tuesday apparently to dismiss speculation about his health.

“Thank for your good wishes,” said the 75-year-old leader who is admitted in a Pune hospital since Sunday evening for ‘minor kidney problem’ and ‘water retention.’

His tweets came after speculation on social media about his health condition.

Meanwhile, in Mumbai, NCP’s Maharashtra unit president Sunil Tatkare said Mr. Pawar was doing “fine” and will be discharged in the next 1-2 days.

Dr. Parvez Grant, Managing Trustee and Chief Cardiologist of Ruby Hall clinic, where the Maratha strongman was admitted on January 24, had said Mr. Pawar was suffering from a ‘minor kidney problem’ and ‘water retention.’ — PTI
title: I’m perfectly fine: Pawar
